ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through taking ART 401, I had the opportunity to learn from incredible photographers about how they approach their work and utilize their advice to work toward my own sustained lens project throughout the semester.
Learned how to really focus on and investigate a theme through a sustained holistic  photography project. A lot of creative freedom to explore and push further as an artist
Working on one body of work throughout the entire semester.
I learned about photography techniques for both film and digital, especially printing and darkroom development.
I learned about how to create and critically discuss photography

Throughout this course, I learned to really focus in on a single project and develop this idea throughout the course of the semester. I learned that sometimes your idea may change over time and evolve into something new; the important thing is to keep making work and exploring your ideas. Not every idea you have is a good one, but keep having ideas. Keep pushing yourself to create more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course allows for in-depth access to incredible photographers and artists with weekly guest speakers and trips to Yale art museums. Additionally, there were fun and exciting projects throughout the semester that allowed us to approach our photography in different ways.
So good! Wish there were more field trips.
Strengths are the amount of field trips. Con is the lack of constructive feedback on our work.
Honestly this class is amazing. I grew so much as an artist and also had so much fun. Its the best class ive taken at Yale and cant think of a single flaw. The workload is also extremely reasonable.
Strengths were being able to work closely with both Lisa, the professor, and Natalie, the TA
This course was quite enjoyable overall - I honestly have no complaints.

I really enjoyed the amount of looking at other work that we did in this class. Whether it be the visiting artist lectures for the MFA program or going to shows at Art Space or the YUAG or YCBA it really expanded the way I was thinking about different projects and methods of accomplishing a project-based goal. I do wish there was a little more accountability-holding for making work or more check-ins/contact sheet editing throughout to be encourage more consistent work-making.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This was an incredible course to take with Professor Kereszi and my TA Natalie.

I absolutely recommend this course! If you are very serious about photography, it is helpful to think about working on it in projects rather than following random ideas. Lisa is a gift! Natalie was also the best TA Ive ever had at Yale! If the Art Department is looking to hire someone, hire Natalie!
If you want to have fun, look forward to class, and grow as an artist, you need to take this course!
Yes, it was a great way to get involved with the School of Art and the photography community at Yale

Yes!! Lisa and Natalie (this semester's TA) were the absolute best. Watching your idea and the ideas of your classmates flourish and change over the course of the semester is something I wasn't able to experience in other photo classes, as this one is particularly project oriented. Throughout the classes, you'll hear guest lectures from photographers and artists of other mediums, as well as do creative assignments such as 'respond to a found photo.' Make sure you make use of the time you have with your teacher and TA, as any opportunity to talk to them is an opportunity to gain a new insight on something. Regardless of how this course is structured, you should take it! It's a great experience and I would definitely do it again if given the opportunity.
